Use and Examples
================

The application software is able to evaluate both homogeneous and made of BIM slopes.
Two examples of those cases are shown below:

Homogeneus slope without watertable
-----------------------------------

This example is the simplest one that can be executed with **pyBIMstab**:

.. literalinclude:: ../examples/figuresScripts/slopestabl_example1.py
   :language: python

.. figure:: https://rawgit.com/eamontoyaa/pybimstab/master/examples/figures/slopestabl_example1.svg
    :alt: shortSCR_example

.. only:: html

   :download:`example script<../examples/figuresScripts/slopestabl_example1.py>`.


Slope made of BIM with watertable
----------------------------------

This example is the most complex one that can be executed with **pyBIMstab**:

.. literalinclude:: ../examples/figuresScripts/slopestabl_example3.py
   :language: python

.. figure:: https://rawgit.com/eamontoyaa/pybimstab/master/examples/figures/slopestabl_example3.svg
    :alt: shortSCR_example

.. only:: html

   :download:`example script<../examples/figuresScripts/slopestabl_example3.py>`.
